RESPONSE TEXT: Doctor Duff handles all the visitors. Bother her.
Despite my recommendations, the city allows anyone to use our equipment. *sigh* Feel free.
I'm in the middle of million things. I have to stay focused.
Please. The research I do here is delicate. Stay out of my way.
I'm glad you returned safely from the Institute, Sentinel.
You did a fine job helping to destroy the Institute, Sentinel.
Sorry, Sentinel... I have quite a few things I must attend to.
As a reward for my service, Elder Maxson allows Doctor Duff to visit me sometimes.
Hello again, Sentinel. I trust all is well with you.
I've taken over robotic repair duties from Proctor Ingram. It's the least I can do.
There's plenty to fix aboard this ship. How did it ever get in such a state?
Proctor Ingram's been kind enough to allow me to stay aboard the Prydwen.
Hopefully I can bring some order to the chaos up here on the Prydwen.
It's much more interesting working up here than scouring the Commonwealth for robot parts.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I appreciate that.
RESPONSE TEXT: Proctor? All the readouts look green. I think it's time for you to activate the power transfer.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Ingram: Actually, I think I'm going to let you press the button.

RESPONSE TEXT: Hm. Where are you going? Was it something I said?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: BoS301Li: It would be better if a trained technician performed that task, but I suppose you deserve to be the one to do it.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm in total agreement with Proctor Ingram. The honor should belong to you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: BoS301Li: Give him a moment, he needs to adjust to his new configuration.
RESPONSE TEXT: Give him a moment, he needs to adjust to his new configuration.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301LibertyPrime: Voice module... online. Audio functionality test... initialized.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Actually, I was looking for you.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh! Well, that puts an entirely different spin on everything, doesn't it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: My name's Professor Scara.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm not leaving until I've spoken to you first.
RESPONSE TEXT: I see... well, forgive me for the false assumption.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: My name's Professor Scara.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm not interested in robots. I came here to find you.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hm. Not the answer I expected, but not altogether unexpected at the same time.
Perhaps we should start again...
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: My name's Professor Scara.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Who's private research site?
RESPONSE TEXT: Well... mine, of course.
The General Atomics Galleria is a rare and unique opportunity to study the robot manufacturer's patented Director software system.
A single master robot controlling a staff of servitor robots which in turn maintain a facility in a self-sufficient manner is... well, remarkable!
Bah... I've already told you too much. Like I said, if you want to study the system yourself, you're going to have to do it somewhere else.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Actually, I was looking for you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Oh! Well, that puts an entirely different spin on everything, doesn't it.
RESPONSE TEXT: My name's Professor Scara.
And in answer to what I expect to be your next question, "Professor" is my first name, not my title.
The whole thing's rather complicated, perhaps I'll explain it to you sometime.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Companion: I once knew a guy who called himself "Doctor," but he didn't tell me that was his actual name until after the physical examination.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: BoS301Scara: The whole thing's rather complicated, perhaps I'll explain it to you sometime.
RESPONSE TEXT: So, now that I've formally introduced myself, perhaps you'd care to tell me why you're here?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I've been sent by the Brotherhood of Steel to ask for your help.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I've been sent by the Brotherhood of Steel to ask for your help.
RESPONSE TEXT: How very interesting. I wasn't aware that you people ever "asked" for anything.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: While I'm flattered that the Brotherhood of Steel would find me useful, I can't help but be wary of your methods and motivations.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Pack your things. You're working for the Brotherhood of Steel now.
RESPONSE TEXT: Am I? I don't seem to recall agreeing to anything of the sort.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: While I'm flattered that the Brotherhood of Steel would find me useful, I can't help but be wary of your methods and motivations.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I've been sent by the Brotherhood of Steel to find you.
RESPONSE TEXT: That seems rather vague.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: While I'm flattered that the Brotherhood of Steel would find me useful, I can't help but be wary of your methods and motivations.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Did you know Doctor Duff was looking for you? She's very worried.
RESPONSE TEXT: Ugh... not this again.
Time after time, I've asked Doctor Duff to join me on these trips but she insists on staying behind in case anyone requires a biology lesson.
Then, when I return after being gone for more than a few days, she scolds me as if I'm a child.
I swear, that woman acts as though we're married.
*Sigh* Obviously you're not here to bring me a message from Doctor Duff, so why don't you tell me the real reason you've tracked me down.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I've been sent by the Brotherhood of Steel to ask for your help.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How very interesting. I wasn't aware that you people ever "asked" for anything.
RESPONSE TEXT: While I'm flattered that the Brotherhood of Steel would find me useful, I can't help but be wary of your methods and motivations.
Perhaps if you were more specific, we could come to some kind of a mutual understanding.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We need your expertise to get Liberty Prime back online.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We need your expertise to get Liberty Prime back online.
RESPONSE TEXT: Liberty... Prime? Where have I heard that before?
Oh... yes... I believe it's some kind of an enormous robot.
Intriguing as it sounds, I'm afraid my work at General Atomics isn't complete.
Perhaps you could come back another time?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe this will change your mind.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We have some robots that need repairing.
RESPONSE TEXT: Please don't insult my intelligence. I'm sure that ship of yours has plenty of able-bodied technicians that can fix up your robots.
If they sent you out here to find me, they're looking for something a little more specialized.
So, you want to try again?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We need your expertise to get Liberty Prime back online.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's classified, but I can tell you that it involves Liberty Prime.
RESPONSE TEXT: Liberty... Prime? Why does that sound so familiar?
Ah! I remember now. I believe it's some kind of an enormous robot.
Well, I'm not sure what types of people you normally deal with, but I certainly won't walk blindly into a situation without all of the details.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe this will change your mind.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You know the Brotherhood of Steel?
RESPONSE TEXT: You're joking, right?
Ever since that behemoth you call an airship arrived here, everyone in Diamond City's talking about it.
The Brotherhood's the biggest thing to hit the Commonwealth since, well... since the Institute set up shop here.
Now, don't avoid the question by changing the subject. Tell me why the Brotherhood's looking for my help.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We need your expertise to get Liberty Prime back online.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Maybe this will change your mind.
RESPONSE TEXT: Intriguing.
So, your technicians must use these to calibrate Liberty Prime's internal power system.
It's quite an ingenious little device, but it could use some work.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: Hmmm... All right, you've got a deal.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We'll just find someone else I suppose.
RESPONSE TEXT: Now hold on a moment. If you think you're going to find someone else in the Commonwealth with my level of expertise, you're sorely mistaken.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: Hmmm... All right, you've got a deal.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We'll just find someone else I suppose.
RESPONSE TEXT: I would advise against that.
Look, I'm interested, I just don't want to abandon my research here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe this will change your mind.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: If we wait too long, Liberty Prime will never walk again.
RESPONSE TEXT: It would be a shame if such a technological marvel went to waste.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: Hmmm... All right, you've got a deal.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: If we wait too long, Liberty Prime will never walk again.
RESPONSE TEXT: I don't know. I'd really like to get all of my work done here first.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe this will change your mind.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Could I stay here and help you, so your work goes faster?

DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: Hmmm... All right, you've got a deal.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Could I stay here and help you, so your work goes faster?
RESPONSE TEXT: Are you kidding me? The last thing I need is someone else interfering with my work.
Look, I'm interested in helping you, I just don't like to leave my experiments incomplete.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe this will change your mind.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's quite an ingenious little device, but it could use some work.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hmmm... All right, you've got a deal.
I'll wrap up my collecting trip and meet you at your headquarters.
Now if you'll excuse me, I still have a few loose ends to tie up before I leave.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCFProctorIngram: Well, things are off to a good start... isn't that right, Doctor?
RESPONSE TEXT: You call this "a good start?"
This poor thing's memory core was completely corrupted. Haven't you people ever heard of inertial dampeners? Titanium shock casing?
Sigh. It won't be easy, but I should be able to make a few modifications and get his basic functions online.
If you can keep your inept scribes from slowing me down.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Sorry about that, Ingram.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: BoS301Ingram: We've already sent out a few teams to find the rest of the High-Powered Magnets you'll need. They should be back by the time you return.

Good luck.

DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Scara: Here's a list of materials you'll need and the plans to make the actuators.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: BoS301Li: These are the plans and the materials list. Don't lose them.
RESPONSE TEXT: Here's a list of materials you'll need and the plans to make the actuators.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Ingram: Now before you get that look on your face, you'll be happy to know that we have plenty of the raw materials on that list right here at the airport.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCFProctorIngram: That's all four actuators... delivered and done. Nice work.
RESPONSE TEXT: Thank goodness.
I've finished restoring Prime's basic programming, but trying to explain to him why he can't walk is testing my patience.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Ingram: Well, as soon as my scribes get those actuators in place, we'll have his arms and legs installed in no time.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: BoS301Li: Without a fully loaded nuke pack, Prime won't have the firepower to take on the Institute.
RESPONSE TEXT: Liberty Prime will be effective when we get him fully operational, but he'll lack the proper firepower needed to penetrate the Institute's defenses.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: She's right.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCFProctorIngram: Looks like the Mark 28's are going to do the trick. That was a good find.

Shouldn't take us more than a day or so.
DIALOGUE AFTER: BoS301Ingram: Well, Professor, I have to admit, we couldn't have done this without you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: BoS301Li: We haven't fully thrown the switch on Liberty Prime and I'm just hoping all the work I've done to keep his systems stable are going to hold.
RESPONSE TEXT: I appreciate the confedence, but I'm still a bit concerned.
We haven't fully thrown the switch on Liberty Prime and I'm just hoping all the work I've done to keep his systems stable is going to hold.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I have full confidence in the abilities of everyone here.

RESPONSE TEXT: We'll get those bombs fitted to Liberty Prime as soon as possible.
Hope those bombs get here soon, otherwise Liberty Prime's weapons efficiency will be fairly limited.
Proctor Ingram wants to talk to you, better hop to it before she releases the hounds.
Shouldn't you be building us some actuators? Prime isn't going to start moving on his own, you know.
Let me finish up here, and I'll meet you at the airport.
Excuse me, but this is a private research site. If you're here to study these robots, I'll have to insist you relocate to somewhere else.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Actually, I was looking for you.

RESPONSE TEXT: Duff, if I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times... stop rearranging my work space. You're driving me crazy.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Duff: Aww. I was trying to surprise you by cleaning it up. I thought you'd be happy.
SCRIPT NOTES: you and Doctor Duff are a classic odd couple / Irritated

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Duff: Aww. I was trying to surprise you by cleaning it up. I thought you'd be happy.
RESPONSE TEXT: Sigh... I'm not mad at you, just frustrated. It might look like a mess, but I have a specific way of organizing everything that I own.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Duff: Oh. Then I'm guessing you won't be happy with how I rearranged our bedroom. Sorry, Professor!

RESPONSE TEXT: Well, don't stand here looking at me. You should be following Liberty Prime.
Make sure Prime gets to the Institute in one piece, or all this was for nothing.
Good luck, Paladin. I hope you return safely.
It all comes down to this. Thank you for letting me be a part of it.
There's nothing to worry about, Paladin. Just head up the gantry and plug in the Agitator.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Duff: You sure you won't help in my next experiment, Professor?
RESPONSE TEXT: Which one? You always do too many at once. How am I expected to keep track of all of them?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Duff: I like to organize them by colors! If the compounds are mostly green, it's a green experiment. Mostly blue? Blue experiment.
SCRIPT NOTES: you and Doctor Duff are a classic odd couple, you like to focus on one thing at a time, she does a thousand things at once / Tired

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Duff: I like to organize them by colors! If the compounds are mostly green, it's a green experiment. Mostly blue? Blue experiment.

DIALOGUE AFTER: DoctorDuff: That was your choice...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DoctorDuff: That was your choice...
